page.title: 10TRIP TO GLENHOLT
page.content: At Glenholt the first thing we saw was the George pub, it sold ales and had a place for children. Its car park had a telephone booth near. We walked on and came to some houses, which had a barrier of trees and bushes to protect the people from noise and car fumes. There was a parking space outside the houses where there was a lot of litter. Nearby was a big green metal storer which kept gravel for melting the snow. Next we came to a garage selling fuel and diesel, it also had a mini shop which sold garden furniture, sweets, lemonade, toys and other things. We crossed the road and walked downan old football pitch. This had a hut at the bottom which was the changing room. We then walk to Buena Vista and further on was open land and moors.
